author: Thomas Ruble
title: Nada: Nodes-as-a-Service
description:
Zero config, instant Cardano node access for free.
In a similar spirit to Infura.io, access to nodes should be free & easy.

assessments.note: Keeping Critical systems components closed source due to security reasons is a terrible excuse.
Nowhere does the proposer benchmark all the node/API services available today such as Adrestia, Blockfrost.io and emurgo hosted services.
The submitter provides enough background information to defend his ability to implement his proposal
Some relevant information regarding outcomes even if they are just projections would also be helpful.
This proposal is missing key details starting with the benchmarking to existing node as a service options.

solution: A backend platform would maintain many horizontally-scalable pools of nodes. Access to these would be controlled via API keys & accounts.
experience: I am a cloud DevOps engineer at Google, with a specialization in automation & enterprise scaling.
